properties.description: the profile properties

properties.title: z/OSMF Profile
properties.description: z/OSMF Profile

user.description: Mainframe (z/OSMF) user name, which can be the same as your TSO login.

password.description: Mainframe (z/OSMF) password, which can be the same as your TSO password.

basePath.description: The base path for your API mediation layer instance. Specify this option to prepend the base path to all z/OSMF resources when making REST requests. Do not specify this option if you are not using an API mediation layer.

encoding.description: The encoding for download and upload of z/OS data set and USS files. The default encoding if not specified is 1047.

responseTimeout.description: The maximum amount of time in seconds the z/OSMF Files TSO servlet should run before returning a response. Any request exceeding this amount of time will be terminated and return an error. Allowed values: 5 - 600

properties.title: TSO Profile
properties.description: z/OS TSO/E User Profile

characterSet.description: Character set for address space to convert messages and responses from UTF-8 to EBCDIC.

codePage.description: Codepage value for TSO/E address space to convert messages and responses from UTF-8 to EBCDIC.

columns.description: The number of columns on a screen.

logonProcedure.description: The logon procedure to use when creating TSO procedures on your behalf.

regionSize.description: Region size for the TSO/E address space.

rows.description: The number of rows on a screen.

properties.title: z/OS SSH Profile
properties.description: z/OS SSH Profile

host.description: The z/OS SSH server host name.

user.description: Mainframe user name, which can be the same as your TSO login.

password.description: Mainframe password, which can be the same as your TSO password.

privateKey.description: Path to a file containing your private key, that must match a public key stored in the server for authentication

keyPassphrase.description: Private key passphrase, which unlocks the private key.

handshakeTimeout.description: How long in milliseconds to wait for the SSH handshake to complete.

properties.title: CA7 Profile
properties.description: A CA7 profile is required to issue commands in the CA7 command group. The CA7 profile contains your host and port for the CA7 instance of your choice.

host.description: Host name of the CA7 API service that is running on the mainframe system.

port.description: Port for the CA7 API service that is running on the mainframe system.

user.description: User name for authenticating connections to the CA7 API service that is running on the mainframe system.

password.description: Password for authenticating connections to the CA7 API service that is running on the mainframe system.

basePath.description: The base path for your API mediation layer instance. Specify this option to prepend the base path to all resources when making REST requests. Do not specify this option if you are not using an API mediation layer.

protocol.description: Specifies protocol to use for CA7 connection (http or https).

properties.title: Configuration profile for CA Spool
properties.description: Configuration profile for CA Spool, where you specify information about your CA Spool instance

spoolhlq.description: High level qualifier of CA Spool installation.

outds.description: The SYSTSPRT data set allocated by CAI.CBQ4JCL(BQ4JZOWE). It must be unique for each Zowe CLI user interacting with CA Spool.

clist.description: The data set containing ESFZOWE REXX exec.

properties.title: Configuration profile for CA View
properties.description: Configuration profile for CA View

protocol.description: Protocol of the target CA View REST API instance.

hostname.description: Hostname or ip address of the target CA View REST API instance.

port.description: Port of the target CA View REST API instance.

basePath.description: Context name of the target CA View REST API instance.

username.description: User name used to authenticate against the target CA View REST API instance.

password.description: Password used to authenticate against the target CA View REST API instance.

properties.title: CICS Profile
properties.description: A cics profile is required to issue commands in the cics command group that interact with CICS regions. The cics profile contains your host, port, user name, and password for the IBM CICS management client interface (CMCI) server of your choice.

user.description: Your username to connect to CICS

password.description: Your password to connect to CICS

regionName.description: The name of the CICS region name to interact with

cicsPlex.description: The name of the CICSPlex to interact with

properties.title: Db2 Profile
properties.description: A profile for interaction with Db2 for the z/OS region

user.description: The Db2 user ID (may be the same as the TSO login)

password.description: The Db2 password (may be the same as the TSO password)

sslFile.description: Path to an SSL Certificate file

properties.title: CA Endevor Bridge for Bridge Profile
properties.description: An EBG profile is required to issue commands in the ebg command group. The EBG profile contains the connection details for the CA Endevor Bridge for Git server of your choice.

protocol.description:
The Endevor Bridge for Git SCM protocol. 

Default value: undefined

host.description: The Endevor Bridge for Git hostname.

port.description: The Endevor Bridge for Git port.

user.description: Endevor Bridge for Git username (your git username).

token.description: Git personal access token (it can be obtained from your Git Enterprise Server).

rejectUnauthorized.description:
Reject self-signed certificates. 

Default value: false

properties.title: CA File Master Plus profile schema
properties.description: CA File Master Plus profile schema.

host.description: Specifies CA File Master Plus server host name.

port.description: Specifies CA File Master Plus server port.

user.description: Specifies Mainframe user name. May be the same as TSO login.

password.description: Specifies Mainframe password. May be the same as TSO password.

protocol.description: Specifies CA File Master Plus REST API protocol.

basePath.description: The base path for your API mediation layer instance. Specify this option to prepend the base path to all FMP resources when making REST requests. Do not specify this option if you are not using an API mediation layer.

properties.title: CA IDMS Profile
properties.description: An IDMS profile is required to issue IDMS CLI commands. The IDMS profile contains your host and port information

host.description: Host name of the IDMS REST API service

port.description: Port for the IDMS REST API service

user.description: Mainframe user name, which can be the same as your TSO login ID

password.description: Mainframe password, which can be the same as your TSO password

datasource.description: Identifies the CA IDMS system where the API request will be sent and is defined in the data sources definition file for the IDMS REST API

basePath.description: The base path for your API Mediation Layer instance. Specify this option to prepend the base path to all resources when making REST requests. Only specify this option if you are using an API Mediation Layer

properties.title: JCLCheck Profile
properties.description: A JCLCheck profile is required to issue commands in the jcl command group that interact with JCLCheck. The JCLCheck profile contains your host and port for the JCLCheck instance of your choice.

host.description: Host name of the JCLCheck API service that is running on the mainframe system.

port.description: Port for the JCLCheck API service that is running on the mainframe system.

user.description: User name for authenticating connections to the JCLCheck API service that is running on the mainframe system.

password.description: Password for authenticating connections to the JCLCheck API service that is running on the mainframe system.

basePath.description: The base path for your API mediation layer instance. Specify this option to prepend the base path to all resources when making REST requests. Do not specify this option if you are not using an API mediation layer.

protocol.description: Specifies protocol to use for JCLCheck connection (http or https).

jclcheckOptions.description: The desired set of JCLCheck runtime options. Specify the options exactly as you would on the PARM= or OPTIONS DD on a batch run of JCLCheck. See the JCLCheck runtime options documentation for details on available runtime options. If you specify options that change the format of the JCLCheck reports, you should request '--raw-output'. Changing the format of the report will affect the ability to produce a structured API response.

properties.title: CA MAT Analyze CLI profile schema
properties.description: CA MAT Analyze CLI profile schema.

protocol.description: Specifies the protocol defined for the CA MAT REST API server (http or https).

hostname.description: Specifies the hostname or IP address defined for the CA MAT REST API server (e.g. 127.0.0.0 or localhost).

zowediscoverable.description: Specifies whether you want to use Zowe API Mediation Layer to process the commands for this profile. Set '--zowediscoverable true' only if you have configured the Zowe API Mediation Layer properties in your CA MAT REST API server settings.

properties.title: CA MAT Detect CLI profile schema
properties.description: CA MAT Detect CLI profile schema.

job_acct.description: Specifies z/OS TSO/E accounting information. Values: numeric characters (0-9)

job_class.description: Your z/OS class information. Values: alphanumeric characters (A-Z, 0-9)

job_mclass.description: Specifies the MSGCLASS parameter value and assigns the job log to the specified output class. The specified MSGCLASS value is used in all JCLs that PMA runs while you execute the commands. If you do not provide the job_mclass parameter, the default MSGCLASS value is used. Values: alphanumeric characters (A-Z, 0-9)

job_load.description: Specifies the PMA loadlib data set name that you defined during the PMA customization (&HLQ.CEETLOAD)

job_pmahlq.description: Specifies your PMA HLQ to access the KSDSALT, KSDSJOB, and KSDSEXC VSAM files to collect the necessary data

properties.title: CLI profile for MQ
properties.description: An MQREST profile is required to issue commands in the MQ command group that interacts with MQSC. The mq profile contains your host, port, user name, and password for the IBM MQ System Console interface

host.description: The MQ Rest server host name

port.description: Port number of your MQ REST API server

user.description: User name to authenticate to your MQ REST API server

password.description: Password to authenticate to your MQ REST API server

protocol.description: Specifies the MQ protocol (http or https).

properties.title: OPS Web Services session profile
properties.description: The OPS Web Services session profile schema, where you specify your session information and credentials

host.description: The hostname of the server where OPS Web Services is running.

port.description: The port number for OPS Web Services.

user.description: Your z/OS user name used to authenticate to OPS Web Services

password.description: Your z/OS password used to authenticate to OPS Web Services

protocol.description: The protocol used for connecting to OPS Web Services

rejectUnauthorized.description: If set to true, the server certificate is verified against the list of supplied CAs. If set to false, certificate verification is not performed.

subsystem.description: Specifies the subsystem id of the CA OPS/MVS instance to which commands will be directed.

properties.title: SYSVIEW REST API connection details
properties.description: The SYSVIEW session profile schema, where you specify your session information and credentials

host.description: The hostname of the SYSVIEW REST API

port.description: The port number of the SYSVIEW REST API

user.description: Your z/OS username used to authenticate to the SYSVIEW REST API

password.description: Your z/OS password used to authenticate to the SYSVIEW REST API

rejectUnauthorized.description: If set, the server certificate is verified against the list of supplied CAs

ssid.description: SSID of the SYSVIEW instance. Default value: GSVX

basePath.description: The base path for your API mediation layer instance. Do not specify this option if you are not using an API mediation layer.

properties.title: SYSVIEW display format details
properties.description: The SYSVIEW format profile schema, where you specify display settings

contextFields.description: Context fields to display. Defaults to hiding all context

info.description: Display the information area, if any

blankIfZero.description: Show a blank space instead of '0' values

truncate.description: Truncate displays that are too wide for the console

properties.title: Configuration profile for z/OS FTP
properties.description: Configuration profile for z/OS FTP

host.description: The hostname or IP address of the z/OS server to connect to.

port.description: The port of the z/OS FTP server.

secureFtp.description: Set to true for both control and data connection encryption, 'control' for control connection encryption only, or 'implicit' for implicitly encrypted control connection (this mode is deprecated in modern times, but usually uses port 990). Note: Unfortunately, this plugin's functionality only works with FTP and FTPS, not 'SFTP' which is FTP over SSH.

rejectUnauthorized.description: Reject self-signed certificates. Only specify this if you are connecting to a secure FTP instance.

servername.description: Server name for the SNI (Server Name Indication) TLS extension. Only specify if you are connecting securely

connectionTimeout.description: How long (in milliseconds) to wait for the control connection to be established.

properties.title: IMS Profile
properties.description: An ims profile is used to issue commands in the ims command group that interact with IMS regions. The ims profile contains your IMS Operations API web server host, port, user name and password, IMS Connect host and port and IMS plex name.

host.description: The IMS Operations API server host name.

port.description: The IMS Operations API server port.

imsConnectHost.description: The hostname of your instance of IMS Connect. This is typically the hostname of the mainframe LPAR where IMS Connect is running.

imsConnectPort.description: The port of your instance of IMS Connect. This port can be found in your IMS Connect configuration file on the mainframe.

plex.description: The name of the IMS plex.

user.description: The web server user name where the IMS Operations API resides.

password.description: The web server user password where the IMS Operations API resides.

basePath.description: The base path for your API mediation layer instance. Specify this option to prepend the base path to all z/OSMF resources when making REST requests. Do not specify this option if you are not using an API mediation layer.

properties.title: The CA Endevor SCM endevor profile
properties.description: The CA Endevor SCM endevor profile schema, where you specify your endevor session information and credentials

host.description: The hostname of the endevor session

port.description: The port number of the endevor session

user.description: The username of the endevor session

protocol.description: The protocol used for connecting to CA Endevor SCM Rest API

basePath.description: The base path used for connecting to CA Endevor SCM Rest API

rejectUnauthorized.description: If set, the server certificate is verified against the list of supplied CAs

properties.title: The CA Endevor SCM element inventory location specification profile
properties.description: The CA Endevor SCM element location, where you specify your working environment, system and subsystem

environment.description: The CA Endevor SCM environment where your project resides

system.description: The CA Endevor SCM system where the element resides

subsystem.description: The CA Endevor SCM subsystem where your element resides

type.description: Name of the CA Endevor SCM element's type

stageNumber.description: The CA Endevor SCM stage where your project resides

comment.description: The CA Endevor SCM comment you want to use when performing an action

ccid.description: The CA Endevor SCM CCID you want to use when performing an action

maxrc.description: The return code of CA Endevor SCM that defines a failed action

properties.title: Qwikref Profile
properties.description: A Qwikref profile is required to issue commands in the jcl command group that interact with Qwikref. The Qwikref profile contains your host and port for the Qwikref instance of your choice.

host.description: Host name of the Qwikref API service that is running on the mainframe system.

port.description: Port for the Qwikref API service that is running on the mainframe system.

user.description: User name for authenticating connections to the Qwikref API service that is running on the mainframe system.

password.description: Password for authenticating connections to the Qwikref API service that is running on the mainframe system.

basePath.description: The base path for your API mediation layer instance. Specify this option to prepend the base path to all resources when making REST requests. Do not specify this option if you are not using an API mediation layer.

protocol.description: Specifies protocol to use for Qwikref connection (http or https).

properties.title: Base Profile
properties.description: Base profile that stores values shared by multiple service profiles

host.description: Host name of service on the mainframe.

port.description: Port number of service on the mainframe.

user.description: User name to authenticate to service on the mainframe.

password.description: Password to authenticate to service on the mainframe.

tokenType.description: The type of token to get and use for the API. Omit this option to use the default token type, which is provided by 'zowe auth login'.

tokenValue.description: The value of the token to pass to the API.
